other_tests.findings: No definite findings to explain patient's symptoms. The liver is cirrhotic, as before. Known hepatic masses are poorly visualized. Splenomegaly.

Aorta and pulmonary arteries are unchanged in appearance including mild dilatation of ascending aorta. Small amount of right pleural effusion most likely is a sequela of substantial ascites, although new since the previous examination.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Small amount of right pleural effusion is new since the previous examination.
